summary: Changes the one handed perk tree to have more skills, support daggers, and generally make the one handed tree a lot more effective, and maybe just a bit more fun.
descriptionHtml:
WHAT IT DO:
-Changes the One-Handed Perk Tree
WHAT IT DON'T:
-Change anything else

This is a very simple mod that I made in the Creation Kit. It changes a lot of the things that I thought were very annoying when playing the vanilla tree.

PERK TREE:
Armsman(1-5): Increases Damage in increments of 25% (25%-50%-75&)
Special Armsman: Your one handed attacks have special effects! (Axes bleed, Maces ignore armor, and swords crit. This is for the three level 30 special perks. I didn't like that you had to get the smallest versions of each effect separately
(When I say same as vanilla I mean I tweaked everything a bit to match with not being able to do twice as much damage.(Crit chance is higher and maces end up ignoring all armor by the end.))
BoneBreaker(1-2): Same as vanilla.
Bladesman(1-2): Same as vanilla.
HackAndSlash(1-2): Same as vanilla.
FightingStance: Power attacks cost 45% less stamina
Critical Charge: Same as vanilla.
Savage Strike: Standing Power attacks do 30% bonus damage and have a chance to decapitate. This doesn't apply to maces because ignoring armor and decapitating and doing bonus damage is too OP
Berzerker: One Handed Power Attacks cost 80% less and deal 15% more damage.
While your weapon is out in combat, take 30% less damage from one handed weapons.
Does not apply to daggers.
Dagger Proficiency(1-3): Daggers do (30/60/90)% more damage while sneaking. 
Penetrating Strike: Daggers ignore 25% armor while sneaking.
Lucky Dervish: While in combat, your dagger always critically strikes, but your attacks only do 75% damage. (While in combat the dagger's stats in your inventory will only show 75% of the damage your weapon has.

Dual Flurry: Unchanged.
Dual Savagery: Unchanged.
Dual Impact: Dual handed attacks ignore 25% armor.

INSTALLATION:
With NMM:
Just click download with NMM and let it work itself.

Without NMM:
Unzip the file, put the esp file in your skyrim data folder.
